headline.main: Three Came Back as The World Held Its Breath

results.snippet: HOUSTON There have been epic voyages of survival in the past, such as the 3,618-mile lifeboat voyage of Captain Bligh, of mutiny on the Bounty fame, in 1789, or the Incredible journey of Sir Ernest Shackleton across the storm-torn Antarctic Ocean in...
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON There have been epic voyages of survival in the past, such as the 3,618-mile lifeboat voyage of Captain Bligh, of mutiny on the Bounty fame, in 1789, or the Incredible journey of Sir Ernest Shackleton across the storm-torn Antarctic Ocean in 1916. But the world did not learn of these feats until years after the event. Last week's saga of Apollo 13 was fought out with most of mankind hanging on each move."

headline.main: WISCONSIN'S G.O.P. SEES A LOVELL BID; Astronaut's Hedge on Race for Senate Buoys Party

results.snippet: MILWAUKEE, April 26 Speculation that Capt. James A. Lovell Jr. would run for they United States Senate in Wisconsin mounted this weekend after the astronaut said that he was still thinking about the race.
results.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE, April 26 Speculation that Capt. James A. Lovell Jr. would run for they United States Senate in Wisconsin mounted this weekend after the astronaut said that he was still thinking about the race.

results.abstract: he decides not to make race

headline.main: LOVELL WON'T SEEK SEAT IN U.S. SENATE

results.snippet: MILWAUKEE, April 27 Gov. Warren P. Knowles said today that Capt. James A. Lovell Jr., the astronaut, had decided not to run for the United States Senate against Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin.
results.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE, April 27 Gov. Warren P. Knowles said today that Capt. James A. Lovell Jr., the astronaut, had decided not to run for the United States Senate against Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin.

results.abstract: astronaut Col F Borman to become vp on July 1

headline.main: Eastern Air Lines Gets Astronaut as Executive

results.snippet: Frank Borman, the astronaut, will leave the space program on July 1 to become a vice president of Eastern Air Lines, the carrier's management announced yesterday before the annual meeting in Houston.

byline.original: By ELIZABETH M. FOWLER

results.lead_paragraph: Frank Borman, the astronaut, will leave the space program on July 1 to become a vice president of Eastern Air Lines, the carrier's management announced yesterday before the annual meeting in Houston.

results.abstract: Borman, at convocation, proposes cooperation in space exploration

headline.main: From Astronaut, a Call For Joint Step in Space

results.snippet: Col. Frank Borman, the astronaut, suggested here yesterday that the United States and the Soviet Union agree to an exchange of space engineers as a first step to cooperation in space exploration.

byline.original: By JOHN NOBLE WILFORD

results.lead_paragraph: Col. Frank Borman, the astronaut, suggested here yesterday that the United States and the Soviet Union agree to an exchange of space engineers as a first step to cooperation in space exploration.

results.abstract: Natl Convocation on Challenge of Bldg Peace, sponsored by Fund for Peace, held, NYC; emerging central issue is whether efforts to broaden cooperation in nonpol fields could begin promptly or has to await resolution of global pol problems; Amers generally argue for promptness, Russians for delay; Under Sec Richardson, Millionshchikov, G A Arbatov, Col Borman, Prof Galbraith, Prof Brzezinski among participants; USSR Amb Malik cancels appearance; panels interrupted by demonstrators on behalf of Soviet Jews; Millionshchikov, Arbatov, Richardson, Galbraith, G W Ball, N E Halaby and W A Harriman illus

byline.original: By PETER GROSE

results.lead_paragraph: Overcoming the day's preoccupation with the news from Cambodia and the Middle East and a token demonstration on behalf of Soviet Jews, panels of prominent Americans and Russians struggled here all day yesterday to find new opportunities for a peaceful dialogue.
